p: Valepotriates from V. jatamansi inhibit Ca v2.2 and Ca v3.1 calcium channels in a selective way which is coherent with the analgesic action of this species in relieving gastrointestinal and rheumatic pain [ 97]. Moreover, studies by Dong et al. [ 98] indicated that its use for alleviating abdominal distention and pain may be mediated through Ca v2.2 channel. Although the information about the anticonvulsant effects of valerian is scarce, studies from Rezvani et al. [ 63] suggested that it is mediated through the activation of the adenosine system.
